conversation.content: [shocked] What the hell—Marcus?
[groaning] Don't just stand there.
[confused] The building was supposed to be empty, we cleared it twice yesterday. [quickly] How did you even get in here? The whole perimeter's been sealed since Tuesday.
[bitter] Yeah well, your security isn't as tight as you think. [coughs] My leg's pinned under this beam and I can't feel anything below my knee.
[firmly] Don't move it, could make things worse. [frustrated] Of all the buildings in this city, you had to break into the one I'm bringing down today?
[strained] Wasn't exactly planning on a reunion. [gasps] The documents I needed were in the basement safe—thought I had more time before the actual demolition started.
Jesus, the charges for the east wall go off in twelve minutes. [anxiously] We need to get you out now or this whole section comes down on both of us.
[sarcastically] Great, so now my life's in your hands. [groans] After everything you cost me, this is how it ends—you deciding whether I live or die.
[sternly] Shut up and listen—when I lift this beam, you're going to slide backward on three. [clearing throat] Don't try to stand, just slide straight back toward that opening.
[quietly] Why are you helping me? After what I did to your sister, the lawsuit, everything—you could just walk away and no one would know.
[empathetically] Because I'm not you, Marcus. [grunting] One... two... three—move! [straining] Keep going, don't stop until you're completely clear of the debris.
[breathing heavily] My ankle's definitely broken but I'm out. [pause] The safe combination is 47-23-89 if you want those documents—they prove you were right about the contractor fraud.
Forget the documents, we've got eight minutes to clear the blast radius. [urgently] Put your arm around my shoulder—we're both getting out of here alive whether we hate each other or not.
[shaky voice] Thank you.
[firmly] Save it for when we're clear. [quickly] That siren means the final warning—we need to move faster or we're both going to be part of this rubble pile.
You know, Sarah always said you were decent underneath all that anger. [wincing] Guess dying together wasn't how I pictured finding out she was right about something.
[angrily] Don't you dare mention her name right now. [exhales] Just focus on moving—left foot, drag, right foot, drag—we're almost to the safety perimeter.
[relieved] There's the medical team by the barriers. [coughs] For what it's worth, I never meant for things to go as far as they did between us.
[exhausted] Yeah well, we made it out, that's what matters. [firmly] After they patch you up, you and I are done—no more buildings, no more surprises, nothing.
[regretfully] Understood, I'll disappear from your life completely this time. [quietly] But those documents in the safe—they clear your name on the Marina project. Consider us even.
